author: Oliver Caffrey
title: Cummins stars in Australia's thrilling MCG Test triumph
text:
Pat Cummins has completed a bumper 2023 by taking his second 10-wicket haul in Tests to power Australia to a thrilling 79-run win over Pakistan at the MCG.
The Australian captain was rewarded with the Johnny Mullagh Medal as player of the Boxing Day Test, finishing with match figures of 10-97 - 5-49 in the second innings - in one of the great fast bowling performances.
During the match he became the 10th Australian to pass 250 Test scalps and capped a superb year as captain.
Of those 10 Australian bowlers, Cummins has the best strike-rate (46.7) and second best average (22.32) behind only Glenn McGrath.
The prolific 30-year-old made all the crucial breakthroughs late on Friday as the hosts bowled Pakistan out for 237 to win the Test and take an unassailable 2-0 in the series, which means Australia retain the Benaud-Qadir trophy.
"Just elated to get over the line and win a tight one," Cummins said.
Pakistan fought bravely during the entire match, but lost 5-18 during a chaotic finish to day four as Australia took the extra 30 minutes after the scheduled stumps to complete the victory.
Mohammad Rizwan and Salman Ali Agha threatened to push Pakistan towards a famous win and break a 28-year winless run in Tests in Australia.
Cummins ended the 67-run partnership between the pair in bizarre and dramatic fashion just 15 minutes before the scheduled close of play.
Australia reviewed a not-out call to Rizwan after a Cummins delivery flew into Alex Carey's gloves.
But after a long review from the third umpire, Richard Illingworth deemed the ball had flicked Rizwan's wristband that was connected to his gloves.
Rizwan was furious with the decision, with Pakistan 5-219 at the time and starting to believe they could pull off the country's highest successful winning chase against Australia.
It was a rollicking end to one of the great MCG Tests, with Pakistan fighting harder than many touring nations usually do on Australian soil.
"A little bit twitchy there with about 100 runs to go and five wickets in hand," Cummins said.
"There was a couple of moments where we really had to fight our way back into that Test match ... just a sense of satisfaction after a good Test match victory."
Cummins stood up in many moments, including claiming the crucial wicket of his opposing captain Shan Masood (60) before tea.
It was fitting Cummins had the final say at the end of Australian cricket's busiest calendar year on record.
After going down 2-1 in a hard-fought series in India, Australia won their first World Test Championship final, retained the Ashes in England, and pulled off a major upset by defeating India in the World Cup decider in Ahmedabad.
"Just a huge year in all formats; a lot of success," Cummins said.
"To top it off by winning a series at home, which we pride ourselves on doing, is a pretty satisfying way to finish off 2023."
Pakistan were expected to be easy pickings for Cummins' team in Australia, but if not for two easy dropped catches from Abdullah Shafique at first slip, the tourists could be celebrating a drought-breaking win.
Shafique put down Mitch Marsh when Australia were reeling at 4-46 in their second innings on Thursday.
The allrounder made Pakistan pay by smashing 96 to help Australia to a match-winning lead of 316.
"We made some mistakes that we lost the game," Pakistan coach Mohammad Hafeez said.
"But as a team I believe that there were a lot of right positives within the team to win the game."

author: Morgan Rimmer, CNN
title: Victims of sexual assault and harassment in the Coast Guard call for major changes after Senate committee‚Äôs new report | Regional/National Headlines | local3news.com
text: (CNN) ‚Äî Five former and current members of the US Coast Guard testified before a subcommittee of the Senate Homeland Security Committee on Thursday about their experiences with sexual assault and harassment while serving and called for major changes to how the Coast Guard handles reports. After months of investigation across both chambers, the Senate Homeland Security Committee‚Äôs subcommittee on investigations released a 48-page majority staff report on Wednesday, detailing the decades of abuse and cover-ups. It‚Äôs the first to be released out of a string of ongoing government inquiries triggered by CNN‚Äôs reporting on a secret Coast Guard probe into sexual abuse at its prestigious Coast Guard Academy. That investigation, dubbed Operation Fouled Anchor, was kept secret from the public and even Congress despite substantiating dozens of past assaults. Meghan Lori Klement, a former Seaman, told the committee Thursday that she had felt like she was in a ‚Äúnightmare‚Äù after she was harassed and assaulted for months by a retired senior chief who was contracted to her base. Klement noted that she was pulled aside and told to ‚Äúthink about the life and career‚Äù of the perpetrator. ‚ÄúI was a young girl, and I was really scared,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúWhen he said those words to me, I lost all hope, felt ashamed and embarrassed. I felt completely discredited, and that has followed me around for 11 years.‚Äù She said a turning point was when someone with a higher rank finally committed to supporting her. ‚ÄúWhen I realized that I had somebody who held some sort of rank and position standing behind me, that is when I became really brave,‚Äù Klement said. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a lot of power in that.‚Äù Klement also said that she has not been given access to the documents around her own case, while she was active duty or afterward. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll see if I ever get (them) back,‚Äù she said. Julian Bell, a Chief Warrant Officer 4, too said he received ‚Äúabsolutely nothing‚Äù about his own case, and that his requests through the Freedom of Information Act have been denied. Crystal Van Den Heuvel, a Yeoman Petty Officer First Class, recounted how a man she worked with told her that he had thought about stealing her underwear on multiple occasions, and that while she was in a car with him, he kept trying to reach into her bag and saying he wanted to smell her underwear. Van Den Heuvel said the man did not stop until she threatened to leave him on the side of the road and have his wife pick him up. During the hearing, Van Den Heuvel pushed for the idea that command should not be able to evaluate victims for a year after they come forward about assault, so that they don‚Äôt face retaliation. Instead, Van Den Heuvel said that victims need an outside agency to evaluate their cases ‚Äúso that there is no conflict of interest‚Äù within command. Several other witnesses agreed, as Van Den Heuvel noted that commanding officers often are friendly with each other, and even went to the Coast Guard Academy together. Shawna Christine Ward, a retired Chief Warrant Officer 4, was one of the witnesses who said that there should be a third party to evaluate victim statements and investigations. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the exact same story, and the Coast Guard is just saying, ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs OK.‚Äô I‚Äôm tired of the words,‚Äù Ward said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm tired of the word ‚Äòcommitment.‚Äô There is no commitment. Words are not enough to fix it. Action actually has to be taken in order to do it.‚Äù In closing, Ward told the committee, ‚ÄúI loved the Coast Guard. I still do. But there is a certain part of the Coast Guard that is completely broken.‚Äù The-CNN-Wire ‚Ñ¢ & ¬© 2024 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.

author: Philipp Kuserau
title: √Ñltester Marathonl√§ufer der Welt stirbt bei Verkehrsunfall - er trug kuriosen Spitznamen
text:
√Ñltester Marathonl√§ufer der Welt stirbt bei Verkehrsunfall ‚Äì er trug kuriosen Spitznamen
Fauja Singh eroberte als ‚ÄûTurban-Tornado‚Äú die Laufwelt und vollendete noch mit 100 Jahren einen Marathon. Die Legende wurde jetzt Opfer eines tragischen Unfalls.
Bias ‚Äì Eine Lauflegende ist f√ºr immer verstummt. Der als √§ltester Marathonl√§ufer der Welt geltende Fauja Singh verstarb im Alter von 114 Jahren bei einem tragischen Verkehrsunfall in seinem indischen Heimatdorf. Ein Leben voller au√üergew√∂hnlicher Rekorde und inspirierender Geschichten fand ein j√§hes Ende.
√Ñltester Marathonl√§ufer der Welt stirbt bei Verkehrsunfall ‚Äì er wurde ‚ÄûTorpedo Turban‚Äú genannt
Der geb√ºrtige Inder, der unter dem kuriosen Spitznamen ‚ÄûTurban-Tornado‚Äú internationale Ber√ºhmtheit erlangte, wurde am Montag beim √úberqueren einer Stra√üe in Bias im Distrikt Jalandhar von einem nicht identifizierten Fahrzeug erfasst. Nach Angaben indischer Medien erlitt Singh eine schwere Kopfverletzung und erlag am Montagabend seinen Verletzungen im Krankenhaus.
Fauja Singh wurde nach Angaben seiner Familie am 1. April 1911 im indischen Bundesstaat Punjab geboren ‚Äì ein offizieller Nachweis seiner Geburt existierte jedoch nicht. Diese fehlende Dokumentation f√ºhrte sp√§ter dazu, dass seine beeindruckenden Laufleistungen nicht ins Guinnessbuch der Rekorde aufgenommen wurden.
Marathon-Legende Fauja Singh begann Laufkarriere erst mit 89 Jahren
Seine au√üergew√∂hnliche Laufkarriere begann erst im hohen Alter von 89 Jahren. Nach dem Tod seiner Ehefrau und eines Sohnes √ºbersiedelte Singh im Alter von 84 Jahren nach England. Dort inspirierten ihn Marathonl√§ufe im Fernsehen dazu, selbst mit dem Laufen zu beginnen. Was als Bew√§ltigung pers√∂nlicher Trauer begann, entwickelte sich zu einer der bemerkenswertesten Sportkarrieren der Geschichte.
Mit seinem charakteristischen langen wei√üen Bart und dem markanten Turban war Singh bei internationalen Wettk√§mpfen stets ein Blickfang. Seinen Spitznamen ‚ÄûTurban-Tornado‚Äú verdankte er seiner beeindruckenden Geschwindigkeit trotz seines hohen Alters.
‚ÄûTurban-Tornado‚Äú wird zur internationalen Lauflegende
Den H√∂hepunkt seiner Karriere erreichte Singh 2011, als er im Alter von 100 Jahren in Toronto einen kompletten Marathon absolvierte. Die 42,195 Kilometer bew√§ltigte er in acht Stunden und elf Minuten ‚Äì eine Leistung, die ihn zum √§ltesten Menschen machte, der jemals diese Distanz gelaufen war.
Singh wurde zu einer internationalen Ikone des Sports. 2004 trug er das Olympische Feuer in Athen und wiederholte diese Ehre 2012 bei den Olympischen Spielen in London. Er drehte Werbespots mit Weltstars wie David Beckham und Muhammad Ali und wurde zu einem Symbol f√ºr Ausdauer und Lebensfreude im hohen Alter.
Seinen letzten offiziellen Wettkampf bestritt Singh 2013 in Hongkong im Alter von 101 Jahren. √úber zehn Kilometer erreichte er das Ziel in einer Zeit von einer Stunde, 32 Minuten und 28 Sekunden.
√Ñltester Marathonl√§ufer der Welt stirbt bei Verkehrsunfall ‚Äì Trauer um eine Sportlegende
‚ÄûMein Turban-Tornado ist nicht mehr‚Äú, schrieb sein Biograf Khushwant Singh auf der Plattform X und teilte mit gro√üer Trauer den Tod seines engen Freundes mit. ‚ÄûEr wurde von einem nicht identifizierten Fahrzeug erfasst, als er die Stra√üe √ºberquerte. Ruhe in Frieden, mein lieber Fauja.‚Äú
Auch Indiens Premierminister Narendra Modi w√ºrdigte den Verstorbenen in den sozialen Netzwerken. ‚ÄûEr war ein au√üergew√∂hnlicher Athlet mit unglaublicher Entschlossenheit‚Äú, schrieb Modi und lobte die ‚Äûeinzigartige Pers√∂nlichkeit‚Äú von Singh und die Art und Weise, ‚Äûwie er die Jugend Indiens f√ºr ein sehr wichtiges Thema der Fitness begeisterte‚Äú. (kus)

author: Dan Beaver
title: Devin Simonson injures wrist, will likely miss the start of Supercross 250 East - NBC Sports
text:
Devin Simonson injures wrist, will likely miss the start of Supercross 250 East
Devin Simonson injured his wrist in a practice crash and required surgery, according to a release by ClubMX. The team does not expect him to return in time to mount up for the Monster Energy Supercross 250 East season opener at Raymond James Stadium in Tampa, Florida, on February 8, 2025.
An announcement about his replacement will come soon.
[Simonson signed with ClubMX](https://www.nbcsports.com/motor-sports/news/devin-simonson-signs-clubmx-supercross-east-contract-for-2025-brandon-haas) before the Pro Motocross season finale Ironman Nationals in Crawfordsville, Indiana, and then secured his best result of the season with a 15th overall.
Simonson approached the ClubMX team before the 2024 Ironman Nationals and then went out to score his best finish of the season. He started in the top three in both motos and capitalized on the momentum with a 15th-place overall result. The current contract was for Supercross only in 2025.

|

title: Straitjacket Alert! MSNBC's Mika Brzezinski Enters Peak Trump Meltdown Mode 12 Days Too Soon
text: The anti-Trump rhetoric is off the charts already, but some of those afflicted with long-term TDS might be peaking too soon. Case-in-point: "Morning Joe" co-host Mika Brezinski, who might want to think about pacing herself. Mika is melting down and there's still 12 days left to go. ‚Äî Tom Bevan (@TomBevanRCP)[https://t.co/Vrs9YW29wm][October 24, 2024] To sum up Mika's Mega-MAGA Meltdown, Trump's Hitler, women and probably everybody else will die if he gets another four years. Gonna have to remove the belts and shoe laces from every employees of this network before Election Day ‚Äî Conservative Masshole Stands With Israel üá∫üá∏üáÆüá± (@TheTimDeFelice)[https://t.co/S47iysE05O][October 24, 2024] Everyone on this show will be on suicide watch if Trump wins. ‚Äî David Harsanyi (@davidharsanyi)[https://t.co/5oJSY353Jj][October 24, 2024] If Trump wins MSNBC might finally be worth watching for hours at a time.

author: archyde
title: National Army prevents terrorist attack in Anor√≠, Antioquia - Archyde
text: In Anor√≠, Antioquia, troops of the National Army carried out an important operation that allowed the location and controlled destruction of an explosive device, thus avoiding a potential attack that had the objective of affecting the civilian population and the Public Force. The operation was carried out in the El Banco village, in the municipality of Anor√≠, as part of compliance with the Ayacucho Strategic Campaign Plan. Follow the WhatsApp channel Public order Two individuals traveling on a motorcycle threw a suspicious package to the side of the road when they noticed the National Army checkpoint, and then fled. These individuals had the intention of carrying out a direct attack against the life and integrity of the inhabitants of the region and against the troops of the National Army. Follow the WhatsApp channel Public order The explosive device was located and destroyed by the EXDE Explosives and Demolitions Group, belonging to the Fourteenth Brigade, complying with all the necessary security measures to guarantee the integrity of the people and nearby properties. With this action, the National Army reiterates its commitment to the security of all the inhabitants of the subregion of Northeast Antioquia and expresses its firm condemnation of any act that threatens the life and tranquility of the population. Furthermore, it reveals the violation of the principles of international humanitarian law and the violation of human rights by the individuals responsible for placing the explosive device. author: Get News
title: Care Right There Remains Committed to Offering Top-Tier Elderly Care in Glassboro, NJ | User | theeveningleader.com
text:
Care Right There in Glassboro, NJ, reaffirms its commitment to providing top-tier elderly care. Known for exceptional services, it offers personalized care plans ensuring seniors' independence and comfort at home. Trust and compassion are at the heart of their mission, making them a trusted leader in home care. Discover more about their dedicated services at https://carerightthere.com. Glassboro, NJ - Care Right There, a prominent provider of elderly care services, today announced its continued dedication to delivering unparalleled home care solutions to the seniors of Glassboro, NJ. Recognized for its exceptional services and as one of the leading home care agencies in Glassboro, NJ, Care Right There is reaffirming its commitment to the community, ensuring that residents have access to the high-quality care they deserve.
"Care Right There has always been at the forefront of providing superior elderly care in Glassboro, NJ. Our goal is to enhance the lives of our seniors, allowing them to maintain their independence and comfort in their homes. We understand the significance of trust and compassion in our care, and our team of professional caregivers is devoted to upholding these values daily," said Marisa A Betancourt, owner of Care Right There.
In response to the growing need for dependable elderly care in Glassboro, Care Right There offers a wide range of personalized services designed to meet the diverse needs of its clients. From daily living assistance to specialized care plans, the agency is dedicated to ensuring the well-being and satisfaction of the seniors it serves. This commitment underscores the importance of accessible, quality home care solutions that support families caring for their aging loved ones.
With the demand for elderly care services rising, Care Right There's steadfast dedication to meeting this demand reflects its deep-rooted commitment to the community of Glassboro, NJ. By continuously striving to provide top-notch care, Care Right There meets and exceeds the expectations of those it serves, solidifying its position as a trusted leader in the home care industry.
For more information about Care Right There and their elderly care in Glassboro, NJ , please visit their website at https://carerightthere.com
About Care Right There Home Care:
Care Right There is a leading provider of elderly care services in Glassboro, NJ. Known for its comprehensive care solutions and a team of dedicated caregivers, Care Right There prides itself on its ability to offer personalized, compassionate care that prioritizes the health and happiness of its clients. As one of the best home care agencies in Glassboro, NJ, Care Right There is committed to enhancing the lives of the elderly in the community, ensuring they receive the respect, dignity, and quality of care they deserve.

Ainda Estou Aqui fez hist√≥ria nesta quinta (23) ap√≥s ser nomeado a tr√™s categorias do Oscar, incluindo Melhor FIlme . E o reconhecimento n√£o veio s√≥ da Academia, veio tamb√©m da cr√≠tica especializada.
Afinal, al√©m das indica√ß√µes, o site Rotten Tomatoes, conhecido por agregar cr√≠ticas de filmes e s√©ries, atribuiu √† produ√ß√£o uma aprova√ß√£o de 95% por parte da cr√≠tica . O que √© o Rotten Tomatoes?
O Rotten Tomatoes √© um site norte-americano que agrega cr√≠ticas de filmes e s√©ries. O portal √© conhecido por ser uma refer√™ncia na avalia√ß√£o cr√≠tica de obras audiovisuais.
O Rotten Tomatoes utiliza um sistema de pontua√ß√£o chamado "Tomat√¥metro", que compila avalia√ß√µes de cr√≠ticos profissionais. O "Tomat√¥metro" representa a porcentagem de cr√≠ticas positivas em rela√ß√£o a um filme. O site tamb√©m considera a opini√£o do p√∫blico, que pode dar sua nota para cada filme.
O nome Rotten Tomatoes significa "tomates podres", em portugu√™s. O nome √© um trocadilho com o antigo h√°bito do p√∫blico de atirar tomates podres quando acham uma performance ruim.
Hist√≥ria sendo feita
Ainda Estou Aqui, primeiro filme original Globoplay, ganhou TR√äS indica√ß√µes ao Oscar: melhor filme internacional, melhor atriz (para Fernanda Torres) e melhor filme, indica√ß√£o in√©dita para o pa√≠s. O an√∫ncio foi feito atrav√©s do perfil oficial da Academia de Artes e Ci√™ncias Cinematogr√°ficas nesta quinta (23).
A 97¬™ cerim√¥nia de entrega dos pr√™mios acontecer√° no dia 2 de mar√ßo, em Los Angeles, na Calif√≥rnia, e ser√° apresentada pelo comediante Conan O'Brien.
A indica√ß√£o de Fernanda Torres √© a primeira do Brasil na categoria em 26 anos. A √∫ltima vez que o pa√≠s teve uma atriz nomeada foi com Fernanda Montenegro, m√£e de Fernanda Torres, por sua atua√ß√£o em Central do Brasil.

author: Manya Marwah
title: Meet Shivani Raja, Indian-Origin UK MP Takes Oath On The Bhagwad Gita
text: Shivani Raja, a Tory politician of Indian origin, was elected to parliament from Leicester East in recently held UK elections, defeating Rajesh Aggarwal, a former London deputy mayor, with 14,526 votes to his 10,100. She was sworn into the British Parliament at the traditional oath-taking ceremony on July 10. Raja has become the first Conservative MP to win the Leicester East seat in 37 years. She took the ceremonial oath on the holy Bhagavad Gita, an act praised by social media community. General Election win ‚ÄúIt was an honour to be sworn into Parliament today to represent Leicester East,‚Äù the 29-year-old Gujarati businesswoman wrote in a post on X. ‚ÄúI was truly proud to swear my allegiance to His Majesty [King Charles](https://www.shethepeople.tv/news/kate-middleton-public-appearance-amid-cancer-battle-4770133) on the Gita.‚Äù It was an honour to be sworn into Parliament today to represent Leicester East.‚Äî Shivani Raja MP (@ShivaniRaja_LE) I was truly proud to swear my allegiance to His Majesty King Charles on the Gita. [#LeicesterEast] [pic.twitter.com/l7hogSSE2C] [July 10, 2024] An X user commented, ''May Bhagvad Gita enlighten you to govern in the best possible manner.'' Another said, ''Wish you all the very best!! Hope the strength and wisdom of Srimad Bhagvad Gita guides you as you discharge and fulfill your duty to your electorate.'' She won the Leicester seat after beating Labour Party opponent Rajesh Agarwal, the former deputy mayor of [London](https://www.shethepeople.tv/shesport/nisha-kumari-cycling-from-vadodara-to-london-4778798), by a significant 4,426 votes. Watch her oath-taking ceremony: Who is Shivani Raja? Shivani's father is of Gujarati descent and came to Leicester in the 1970s, while her mother is from [Rajkot](https://www.shethepeople.tv/news/delhi-rajkot-fires-children-killed-compliance-safety-challenges-4611992). She graduated with a Pharmaceutical and Cosmetic Science degree from De Montfort University, after which she worked in the corporate sector with cosmetic brands in England. The 2024 elections are her political debut, where she displaced the [Labour Party](https://www.shethepeople.tv/womens-firsts/mp-preet-kaur-gill-labour-party-uk-general-election-5129771) from the Leicester East constituency for the first time in almost four decades. Her vision as MP for Leicester East includes better roads, schools and hospitals, safer streets, community cohesion, supporting local businesses, creating jobs and opportunities and mitigating illegal immigration, as per her website.
